summary: This bill, the Asunción Valdivia Heat Illness, Injury, and Fatality Prevention Act of 2025, directs the Secretary of Labor to establish a worker heat protection standard to safeguard workers from heat-related injuries and illnesses. It mandates employers to provide safe workplaces, outlines worker protection standards including engineering and administrative controls, and specifies training, health protocols, and employer duties. The bill sets timelines for rulemaking, emphasizes transparency, and defines key terms related to heat stress and related illnesses.
